title: bit_dream
author: bit_dream
content: White Paper: https://docs.atomicals.xyzOfficial recommendation: https://twitter.com/atomicalsxyzIntroduction to the Atomicals protocol:The Atomicals protocol is a simple and flexible protocol used to cast, transmit, and update digital objects (traditionally referred to as irreplaceable tokens) for unused transaction output (UTXO) blockchains such as Bitcoin. Atoms (or "atoms") are a way of organizing the creation, transmission, and updating of digital objects - they are essentially digital ownership chains defined according to some simple rules.The protocol has built-in modules such as NFT, containers, domains, and tokens, which can be directly used for issuing/casting operations.Current module:1 NFT: By storing binary data in uxto, additional content can be added.2 Container: Reserved for the project team's collection. The project team can directly cast all NFTs into the collection, or add content to the collection. Additional content can be added.3 Domain: Preemptive and unique. There are sub domain concepts.4 Tokens: built-in deployment/issuance and fair launch rules for tokens. Decentralized indexing.Developer team and project built on Atomicals:Wizz Wallet Signboard: https://wizz.cash/dashboardATOM wallet (Google plugin/includes mobile): https://atomicalswallet.com/satsxCasting platform: https://satsx.ioOfficial domain query: https://realm.name/punkIndexing and NFT duplicate checking tools: https://crypt0biwan.github.io/atomical-nft-viewer/Inscription Browser: https://atomicalmarket.com/atomical/0
